data.question: What is the chemical formula for the bismuth ellagate MOF known as SU-101?
What method was used to determine the crystal structure of SU-101 due to its small crystallite size?
What is the BET surface area of SU-101 synthesized using reagent-grade ellagic acid after washing with water and ethanol?
What is the estimated isosteric heat of adsorption for SO2 in SU-101?
How was the colloidal stability of SU-101 in water and RPMI media measured over time?
What was the H2S adsorption capacity of SU-101 in the first cycle of the breakthrough experiment?
What additional peaks appear in the Raman spectrum of SU-101 after H2S adsorption, indicating the formation of polysulfides?
What change was observed in the FTIR spectrum of SU-101 after H2S adsorption, suggesting interaction with polysulfides?
data.answer: The band characteristic of the phenolate stretching vibration shifted from 3408 cm-1 to 3100 cm-1

data.question: What was the cell viability of HL-60 cell line after 24 hours incubation with 1000 µg/mL of SU-101?
What synthesis conditions were used for SU-101 to ensure a green and ambient process?
data.answer: Aqueous suspension of bismuth acetate and ellagic acid stirred under ambient conditions for 48 hours

data.question: Why was acetic acid introduced as a modulator in the synthesis of SU-101?
data.answer: To improve phase purity and synthesis reproducibility

data.question: How does the synthesis of SU-101 contribute to the field of green chemistry?
data.answer: It utilizes nonhazardous or edible reagents under ambient aqueous conditions, enabling simple scale-up

data.question: What makes SU-101 a promising material for environmental and biological applications?
data.answer: Its remarkable chemical stability, biocompatibility, and high H2S adsorption capacity

data.question: Is the synthesis of SU-101 scalable and cost-efficient?

Is the adsorption of H2S by SU-101 fully reversible?

Is the cytotoxicity of SU-101 higher than its precursors towards HL-60 cells?
